description: A small, portable device that projects 3D holographic images, useful for displaying maps, blueprints, or decoys.

A handheld device for accessing, storing, and transferring data. Can be used to access archives, or communicate remotely.

Device Integrity: 2
Firewall: 6
IC Level: 3
Signal Range: 10
A compact, rechargeable power source used to fuel various gadgets, tools, and small vehicles.
A portable device that scans the environment for life forms, energy signatures, or chemical compositions wihin a 5km radius. Ideal for exploration and investigation.
A high-powered cutting tool that uses plasma to slice through metal and other tough materials. Essential for breaching barriers.
A collapsible, lightweight shelter that provides protection from the elements and hostile environments. Can be set up quickly in any terrain.
A breathing apparatus that filters and purifies the air, making it safe to breathe in toxic or low-oxygen environments.
Compact, nutrient-rich food supplies designed for long-term storage and consumption during expeditions or emergencies. Each pack sustains for one day.
A portable device that extracts and purifies water from the environment, ensuring a clean and safe water supply in any situation.
A heat-reflective blanket that provides warmth and insulation in extreme cold conditions. Compact and easy to carry.
A distress signal device that broadcasts your location to nearby allies or rescue teams. Equipped with a variety of signal modes.
Boots equipped withgravity technology or magnets, allowing the wearer to traverse difficult terrain, including zero-gravity environments.
Ropes, hooks and other devices to help safely climb buildings or rocks.
A portable solar panel that can charge batteries and devices using sunlight, essential for long-term survival away from civilization.
A medical tool that injects biofoam into wounds to stop bleeding. Requires 4 AP to use.

A healing salve that promotes rapid tissue regeneration, effective for treating wounds, burns, and other injuries. Once applied, it provides +4 pool bonus to the nightly regeneration, and regenerates and extra 20% of the maximum health.

A quick-injection drug (requires 3 AP to use) that boosts physical performance, increasing strength, speed and constitution by +2 for 10 minutes.

After that, the user loses 1d6 health (cannot cause an injury roll).

A quick-injection drug (requires 3 AP to use) that either provides +2 AP for 5 minutes, or that wakes up someone who became unconscious.

After the 5 Minutes are over, an Injury roll with 5 dice must be made, but the maximum severity suffered is limited to 1.

A cognitive booster in the form of a pill that sharpens mental faculties, improving memory, focus, and problem-solving abilities for a limited time.
It takes 5 Minutes for the effects to kick in. The user then gains +1 Intelligence and Education for 6 hours.

When the effects wear off, the user suffers the "Dizzy" wound.
A cure for most viruses and infections, providing immunity or relief from symptoms.

A drug that blocks pain receptors, allowing the user to function normally despite injuries or other debilitating conditions.
It takes 5 Minutes for the effects of the pill to kick in. The user then ignores the effects (but not injury pool modifiers) of all severity 1 and 2 wounds for 1d6 hours.

When the effects wear off, the user suffers the "Nausea" wound and has to make a Survival d2 roll. If failed, they become addicted or suffer withdrawal symptoms.

A quick-injection drug (requires 3 AP to use) that increases combat efficiency, boosting reflexes, accuracy, and aggression.
The user gains +1 pool bonus to all physical combat related checks, and reduces the pool of their injury checks by 2 (to a Minimum of 0). Lasts for 10 Minutes.

When the effects wear off, the user suffers 2d6 damage (ignoring armor).
A drug that can either suppress the need for sleep or induce restful sleep, depending on the dosage and application.
A drug that induces vivid hallucinations, which can be used recreationally or for nefarious purposes, like disorienting an enemy.
A set of tools and basic supplies to perform first aid or even surgery.

This circular tool can be placed around a person's alive or dead head. Over 5 Minutes it will create a scan to create an engram of their mind, but it will irrevocably destroy the brain in the process. The engram is typically faulty or incomplete, but can be sufficient to be used in a simulation for further questioning.
A set of tools specifically designed for bypassing security systems, including lockpicks, signal jammers, and data scramblers.
Once applied to a MagLock, the device requires 1d6 minutes to find the right combination, opening the lock once.
A wearable cloak that adapts to the surrounding environment, providing camouflage. While being stationary or moving cautiously, gain +3 pool to any attempts to stay hidden.

Allows to apply a paste that will change the facial structure into a specific shape, by programming it once through a Data Pad. The cream can be re-used later by mixing it with a solution that costs half the price of the cream itself.
A device hidden near the throat that alters the user’s voice to mimic others or create entirely new vocal patterns, useful for impersonation or deception.
A handheld scanner that detects and neutralizes hidden surveillance devices within half a meter of the device, including cameras, microphones, and tracking beacons.
A tiny device that sticks to surfaces and will record and broadcast audio in its surroundings to connected devices. Has a broadcasting range of 250m.
A small device that can easily be stuck in corners, plants or similar to record video in a fixed angle, broadcasting its signal to connected devices. Has a broadcasting range of 50m.
A neural device that temporarily erases short-term memories, useful for covering tracks or avoiding interrogation.
Can copy physical and card-based keys swiftly.
A tiny, nearly undetectable transmitter that can be planted on a target to track their movements or relay information. Has a broadcasting range of 10km.
A portable device that emits white noise to mask conversations, preventing eavesdropping and protecting against audio surveillance.
A compact device that combines high-definition zoom with directional audio capture, allowing you to spy on distant targets and eavesdrop on conversations with precision.
A portable fabricator that can create physical objects from digital blueprints using various materials. Ideal for crafting custom tools or parts.
A handheld device that scans items to identify their components, making it easier to disassemble or reverse-engineer technology.
A specialized set of tools for installing, repairing, or upgrading cybernetic implants and prosthetics.
A device that breaks down junk and scrap into usable materials, reducing waste and providing resources for repairs.
A versatile tool kit that can transform into different configurations such as a wrench, screwdriver, or laser cutter. Essential for repairs and tinkering.
A mini lab consisting of various devices to synthesize components.
Allows one repair attempt on a critically damaged ship part. Is used up with the attempt.
Allows one repair attempt on a damaged firearm or smaller piece of technology. Is used up with the attempt.
Allows for a Tech d0 check, requiring one hour of time. Each success restores 2 points of durability of the damaged armor. Then the Fixgel is used up.
Provides a digital, legal permit to possess one specific weapon or cyberware. This is only relevant for items that fall under military regulations and that can be used offensively.

A wrist-mounted or handheld device that allows for real-time holographic communication across vast distances.

Device Integrity: 2
Firewall: 6
IC Level: 3
A device that instantly translates spoken or written language, allowing communication with any species or dialect.
A digital currency storage device that allows the user to make transactions and store funds securely.
A device that immerses the user in a virtual environment, useful for entertainment, training, communication or direct drone control.
Can display certain virtual overlays, e.g. to make digital ads in front of stores visible, or to read messages on the fly, keeping the hands free.
